flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: This project will help you to hack your doorbell to send Push notification and an email with an attached picture when somebody's at the door. It use the free PushingBox service to delegate all the programming part and make things easy.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This project will help you to hack your doorbell to send Push notification and an email with an attached picture when somebody's at the door. It use the free PushingBox service to delegate all the programming part and make things easy.

Relevant parts
  • Arduino or clone

lines.text: How does it work ?
lines.text_raw: How does it work ?

lines.text: 1. When the doorbell is pushed, the Arduino sends an HTTP request to the PushingBox API.
lines.text_raw: 1. When the doorbell is pushed, the Arduino sends an HTTP request to the PushingBox API.

lines.text: 2. PushingBox launches the user's scenario and gets a picture from the web camera.
lines.text_raw: 2. PushingBox launches the user's scenario and gets a picture from the web camera.

lines.text: 3. PushingBox sends a Push notification to the user's phone and a mail message with the picture attached.
lines.text_raw: 3. PushingBox sends a Push notification to the user's phone and a mail message with the picture attached.

lines.text: Prepare your material. You need:
lines.text_raw: Prepare your material. You need:

lines.text: An Arduino + Ethernet Shield
lines.text_raw: An Arduino + Ethernet Shield

lines.text: A Doorbell
lines.text_raw: A Doorbell

lines.text: A soldering iron
lines.text_raw: A soldering iron

lines.text: A 10K resistor
lines.text_raw: A 10K resistor

lines.text: A web camera (optional)
lines.text_raw: A web camera (optional)

lines.text: Open your doorbell.
lines.text_raw: Open your doorbell.

lines.text: Solder wires to the button's terminals.
lines.text_raw: Solder wires to the button's terminals.

lines.text: Close the doorbell.
lines.text_raw: Close the doorbell.

lines.text: Plug the wires into the Arduino.
lines.text_raw: Plug the wires into the Arduino.

lines.text: One wire on the 5v pin;
lines.text_raw: One wire on the 5v pin;

lines.text: One wire on the 3rd input pin;
lines.text_raw: One wire on the 3rd input pin;

lines.text: The 10K resistor between GND and the 3rd pin.
lines.text_raw: The 10K resistor between GND and the 3rd pin.

lines.text: Test the connectivity with a simple Arduino program.
lines.text_raw: Test the connectivity with a simple Arduino program.

lines.text: The hardware part is finished. Let's define the way you will be notified.
lines.text_raw: The hardware part is finished. Let's define the way you will be notified.

lines.text: Go to http://www.pushingbox.com.
lines.text_raw: Go to http://www.pushingbox.com.

lines.text: Login with your Google account.
lines.text_raw: Login with your Google account.

lines.text: Go to the My Services page.
lines.text_raw: Go to the '''My Services''' page.

lines.text: Click on Add a service.
lines.text_raw: Click on '''Add a service'''.

lines.text: Click on the service by which you want be notified.
lines.text_raw: Click on the service by which you want be notified.

lines.text: Use Prowl or Pushme.to for iPhone Push notification;
lines.text_raw: Use '''Prowl''' or '''Pushme.to''' for iPhone Push notification;

lines.text: Notifry for Android Push notification;
lines.text_raw: '''Notifry''' for Android Push notification;

lines.text: Toasty for Windows Phone Push notification.
lines.text_raw: '''Toasty''' for Windows Phone Push notification.

lines.text: Enter the name of your new service and fill in the API that this application gave you when you installed it.
lines.text_raw: Enter the name of your new service and fill in the API that this application gave you when you installed it.

lines.text: Click Submit.
lines.text_raw: Click '''Submit'''.

lines.text: Now, go to the My Scenarios page.
lines.text_raw: Now, go to the '''My Scenarios''' page.

lines.text: Create a scenario called "Somebody's at the door".
lines.text_raw: Create a scenario called "Somebody's at the door".

lines.text: Click on Create scenario.
lines.text_raw: Click on '''Create scenario'''.

lines.text: Click on Add an Action.
lines.text_raw: Click on '''Add an Action'''.

lines.text: First, add an action using the Email Service.
lines.text_raw: First, add an action using the Email Service.

lines.text: Fill in the mail Subject and the Body.
lines.text_raw: Fill in the mail Subject and the Body.

lines.text: The third field is optional and is for attaching a shot from your IP camera to the email. Fill in the URL (publicly reachable) of your web camera. The camera's output must be a picture less than 100KB in size.
lines.text_raw: The third field is optional and is for attaching a shot from your IP camera to the email. Fill in the URL (publicly reachable) of your web camera. The camera's output must be a picture less than 100KB in size.

lines.text: Do the same with your Push notification service and click the Back button.
lines.text_raw: Do the same with your Push notification service and click the '''Back''' button.

lines.text: Your scenario is now created.
lines.text_raw: Your scenario is now created.

lines.text: Click on "Test" to test the scenario.
lines.text_raw: Click on "Test" to test the scenario.

lines.text: You should receive a Push notification on your phone and an email.
lines.text_raw: You should receive a Push notification on your phone and an email.

lines.text: Make a note of the "DeviceID" value of this scenario. You will paste it into the Arduino code.
lines.text_raw: Make a note of the "DeviceID" value of this scenario. You will paste it into the Arduino code.

lines.text: Download the Arduino source code from the PushingBox API page and open it.
lines.text_raw: Download the Arduino source code from the PushingBox API page and open it.

lines.text: In the <tt>#define DEVID1</tt> line, paste the DeviceID of your scenario. Make sure you enclose it in quotes as shown.
lines.text_raw: In the ``#define DEVID1`` line, paste the DeviceID of your scenario. Make sure you enclose it in quotes as shown.

lines.text: Compile the code and program your Arduino.
lines.text_raw: Compile the code and program your Arduino.

lines.text: You're done! Test it, install it on your door and enjoy! :)
lines.text_raw: You're done! Test it, install it on your door and enjoy! :)

guide.summary: Use an Arduino and an optional IP camera to build a doorbell that sends you a Push notification on your phone and an email with a picture of the person at the door.
guide.title: Notifying Doorbell with PushingBox
